page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF THE BLOCK
page.content: The area described in the following section is part of the Borough of {Ellesmere Port and Neston.}Ellesmere Port is a relatively new town in the N.W. corner of Cheshire, on the banks of the{river Mersey. This section is largely a description of life in an area of {modern housing estates}surrounding and almost overwhelming several{ancient {villages.}There are few indigenous inhabitants or customs. The attractions of employment and good modern housing brought large numbers from such places as Wolverhampton, Liverpool and Luton to this once tranquil, rural landscape, a landscape still in existence along the western margin of this area.
